summary: design and implement the js chaincode plugin mechanism
description: the format of the chaincode source chaincode should be written as commonjs modules and be with the node.js engine how does the chaincode get discovered and loaded into the node.js app a package.json must accompany is chaincode sources in the root folder of the chaincodepath parameter during chaincode install

the package.json is critically important for two purposes specifies any dependencies including the package itself which is needed by all js chaincodes and any other external dependencies using the scripts section to specify how the chaincode should be launched do we allow js chaincodes to have other source dependencies in other words can a js chaincode by broken up into multiple modules yes definitely how do we ensure multiple install operations produce the same binary from npm install use best practices with shrinkwrap.json

summary: chaincode platform for handling javascript chaincode docker builds
description: node.js chaincode platform should be responsible for the following build steps that result in a image during chaincode instantiation using build the chaincode package by running within the chaincode source folder which must contain a package.json along with the chaincode source itself create a package that contains the entire app folder including the package.json chaincode js source files and any other source files one or more folder resulted from the npm install step above the runtime image should be based on fabric-baseimage which already contains node engine and npm but we be using that since all dependencies will have been resolved in the build steps and contained in the chaincode

summary: orderers should reject incoming config messages
description: as things stand today the orderer does not reject transactions of type headertype_config this should not be the case it is the orderers that are tasked with validating/authorizing incoming configuration updates and they do so by receiving messages of type and turning them into properly validated messages of type we should be preventing malicious clients from being able to submit config messages otherwise we run the risk of the peer crashing upon receiving malformed/unauthorized config messages

summary: slow performance of anoncred-generated wql for proof request
description: the wql generated by anoncreds for a proof request generates a very poorly performing sql on a wallet with a large number of credentials creds and the query slows linearly with the number of credentials so as the wallet grows the query slows
with the bc gov von database million credentials this makes the proof request unusable
the generated wql checks for attribute existence first and then filters on equality operators
reversing the order of these subqueries equality first then attribute existence solves the performance issue

the attribute existence check results in a large number of records basically every credential of the requested type which is then filtered using the equality operators filters on values of specific when reversing the order the query does the equality check first value of specific attributes which results in a much smaller number of records ideally which is then filtered by the attribute existence options to improve query performance database indexes i was able to gain marginal improvements by tuning the database indexes but the root cause is the number of records selected in the initial part of the query so this still suffered slow performance with large numbers of credentials
translation this is done within the storage and is a straightforward conversion
the wql structure determines the sql structure exactly
since the storage only deals with queries the does not have any information about the nature of the query in order to do any optimization
i have added sample wql and sql in comments before and after database structure the database structure is restricted base on the requirements of item content is encrypted as are tag values
the deals only with encrypted values and does not have information on the nature of the query
there are only tables involved in this query item and so i think any optimization possible in the based on the information available

summary: upgrade node.js chaincode engine to
description: among other things introduced native async and await support that transforms messy source code like this to this also performance benefits due to ignition interpreter and turbofan jit note that node does not enter lts service status until october exact date to be determined but we have obtained agreement from node.js engine committers for support on possible bug fixes during the interim

thus we felt appropriate to introduce the node.js chaincode feature directly on top of node rather than for developers who are writing both chaincode and client applications with the node.js sdk although the node.js sdk may still be stuck on for official support pending further discussions the good news is that node has excellent backward compatibility so they should be able to continue to write both code for app and chaincode under node and test
as long as they accidentally introduce language features that are not supported by in the client app they should be fine

summary: sdk support node.js sdk
description: the current protocol how the responsibility for golang is like this given the chaincode path build a chaincode package that includes all the dependencies then the sdk sends the package to the peer to install then the sdk calls the peer to instantiate the chaincode

if instantiating for the first time it may get instantiated multiple times for different channels the peer will use the environment to build it into native binaries and package the resulting binary into a custom docker image based on a base image for this protocol can be directly translated to handling node.js chaincode lifecycles like the following given the node.js chaincode path which is expected to be a folder containing the chaincode js code plus package.json to declare dependencies then the sdk sends the package to the peer to install then the sdk calls the peer to instantiate the chaincode

if instantiating for the first time the peer will use the environment to build it by running npm install production and package the resulting folder into a custom docker image based on a base image at the moment does not have node.js engine so we should use fabric-baseimage for another option is to utilize the car support

summary: define the code package content structure
description: what files should be contained in the code package of the chaincodedeploymentspec for a javascript chaincode two files are the main ones chaincode.js does not have to be named exactly as such because the chaincode container will use npm start to launch the container instance
this module gets called by the node.js engine and should start the shim by calling it will implement the init and invoke functions required by the chaincode api interface

it can require other source modules with require or external modules with require package.json is critical in two aspects one is to declare how to launch the chaincode program by providing a scripts section that has a start entry which will be used by the chaincode container to start the chaincode program with npm start another is to declare the runtime dependencies

summary: code structure design and initial impl of node chaincode shim
description: the runtime image should be built based on the fabric-baseimage image which already has node and npm and add the following pieces module grpc the chaincode should be the main entry point to start the app all shim interface's functions should be implemented in the package arguments passing the sdk and the chaincode should be json based instead of byte arrays note a significant internal refactoring on the communication protocol the peer and chaincode container during endorsement is being worked on with the main goal to eliminate fsm basing the javascript shim implementation on the refactored code should be preferred

summary: add hasouvalue function to cid library
description: public cas do not support the inclusion of extra extension attributes like the one used for chaincode access control in fabric that had oid this obliges the use of to be able to use certificate attributes with the cid library
for some organizations it is not allowed by the security department to use and they prefer to use other ca services
access control in the chaincode could also be done by using other fields in the certificates like for example the ou field of the subject
the advantage of using the ou field is that it is a standard field and that the distinguished name of a certificate subject can have multiple ou values

the objective of this jira story is to add a method in the cid library that looks for a specified ou value in the certificate of the transaction sender so the cid library can also be used for access control based on ou values and people do not have to write their custom function for it
link to public one pager with more information

summary: enable mutual tls support for orderer nodes
description: the orderer already supports the ability to enable enforce mutual tls however it does not support updating the trusted root certificates for clients based on channel membership

in order to accomplish this a callback needs to be triggered everytime there is a config update and if mutual tls is required the list of trusted client cas can be updated by using the capability of the comm.grpcserver component to dynamically update cas at runtime

the channel resource/config manager already supports the ability to invoke callback functions on config updates so all that is required is to create the callback function and hook all of this together

summary: investigate certificate pinning for grpc tls

summary: resolve licensing issues discovered by fossology scan
description: context hyperledgerexplorer source files from april were scanned by the linux foundation utilizing fossology to determine license for files contained in the following repositories from the hyperledger charter section all files that are included in hyperledger projects should either be licensed with the apache license version for source code or creative commons attribution international license for documentation

expected behavior all files should have license text included either directly or via a license file in the directory for files that cannot be modified to include a comment with the license text think binary actual behavior see attached results ofthe scan
to fix the package metadata files generally bower.json package.json for npm incorrectly describe the hyperledgerexplorer as licensed underisc rather than apache
default isiscso this is a common mistake
highlighted these instances in the attached reports

these files should be changed from isc to for files with attribution license ideally we would replace those with apache files and dependencies otherwise we will need to go to the hyperledger governing board for anexception

for all files that do not have a license included the first step is to check with the contributor to ensure that the file can be released as apache or if the contributor agrees the file should be modified to include the license
you can utilize spdx identifiers represent the correct license
for those files you will need to include a license file in the directory containing the license that the files are covered by
here are a few examples of how this might be done opnfv apex this is an example of explicitly calling out apache for source code and for docs
containerd see notice at bottom
this also calls out the separate apache explicitly references the docs directory
before closing this bug please let me know that you have made the above changes
i will then run thecode through fossology ensure the changes

summary: full testing of patch sprint
description: full testing of a patch to ensure no bugs are found

if bugs are found the team will open a bug in the current sprint and fix the bug and submit another patch which will need to be test should be done with and branch perform a test with at least a blocks in your ledger
if there are any bugs please create a bug and steps to recreate
if the bug already exists please do not create a new one

summary: add channel backend implementation
description: see ashish did analysis you can implement in the node backend add a channel service under setup instructions for create new channel set path to configtxgen tool in your bashrc file on ubnuntu you can use command sudo nano bashrc export save the file and refresh use command source bashrc update config.json file look for the key configtxgentoolpath should match your configtxgen tool path update in file to your fabric network path everytime you add a new channel you need to define it in file search for keyword newchannel and update it to the name of your new channel
